communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    1. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    Order of Nine Angles (O9A/ONA).
    2. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    group Satanic Front in Azle, Texas.
    3. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    usernames CommandantCultus, Commandant Cultus, or ccultus.com.
    4. Any and all investigative and non-investigative records, including
    cross-referenced records, mentioning, referring to or pertaining to the
    group New Resistance based in Boston.
    
    Please interpret the scope of this request broadly. Your agency is
    instructed to interpret the scope of this request in the most liberal manner
    possible short of an interpretation that would lead to a conclusion that the
    request does not reasonably describe the records sought.
    
    Please conduct searches for cross-referenced records. Please additionally
    conduct searches of:
    - SENTINEL
    - Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR), Microphone Surveillance (MISUR), Physical
    Surveillance (FISUR) and Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records/indices
    - Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW), including IDW-S, SPT, and DOCLAB-S
    sub-systems/indices
    - Data Integration and Visualization System (DIVS)
    - Law Enforcement National Data Exchange (N-DEx)
    - Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS)
    
    If any responsive or cross-referenced records have been destroyed and/or
    transferred to NARA, please provide all records related/pursuant to their
    destruction/transfer. This includes but is not limited to:
    - Confirmation of destruction and destruction slips
    - File Numbers or other forms of ID of the aforementioned destroyed records
    - Records with any references to the destruction of the aforementioned
    destroyed records
    - Transfer slips
    - Any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said
    transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that
    the your agency has no other copies of said records.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    ZN

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.communication: I would like to limit my request to information within the FBI regarding the Order of Nine Angles inside the United States and activity of US persons related to the Order of Nine Angles in foreign countries.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1561430-000, 1561435-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

title: Ira Einhorn

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Ira Einhorn
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Ira Samuel Einhorn (May 15, 1940 - April 3, 2020). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/07/us/ira-einhorn-dead.html Records on Einhorn are likely to exist as Einhorn was a fugitive from 1981 to 1997.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters and the Paris LEGAT. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1616531-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.

Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 360 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kyra Fields

The closure reason supplied was: We have redacted personal information, including but not limited to, telephone numbers, social security numbers, credit card numbers and other personal identifying information pursuant to the constitutional rights of privacy and to protect against identity theft pursuant to Government Code 7927.700. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Oakland, CA.

title: Water Asset Management funds correspondence

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax



Confidentiality: The information contained in this e-mail and any attachment(s) hereto is confidential and may be legally privileged. communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.

Renee

communications.communication:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Wesley Lowery.

title: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the guidance issued to school districts concerning "Patriotic Displays," as referenced in the August 29, 2024 press release by Ryan Walters and/or the Oklahoma State Department of Education.

2. A copy of any report submitted by any district detailing their policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:

Thank you for contacting the Oklahoma State Department of Education ("OSDE"). 

We received the Open Records Request you submitted on 08/29/24, 11:00 PM. Your request has been assigned ORR #: 24-426. 

Your request below will be fulfilled as soon as the records are available and approved for release within a reasonable amount of time in accordance with applicable law. 

ORR #: 24-426 
Date Submitted: 08/29/24, 11:00 PM 
Your Name: Adam Steinbaugh 
Affiliation Type: Member of the Public 
Organization Name: N/A 
Address: MuckRock News DEPT MR 172687, 263 Huntington Ave 
City: Boston 
State: Massachusetts 
ZIP Code: 02115 
Phone: 6172991832 
Email: 172687-72550621@requests.muckrock.com 
Purpose of Request: Public Interest 
Due Date: 08/30/24 
Type of Information Requested: Other 
Other Type of Information Requested: 
Requested Records: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. A copy of the guidance issued to school districts concerning "Patriotic Displays," as referenced in the August 29, 2024 press release by Ryan Walters and/or the Oklahoma State Department of Education. 

2. A copy of any report submitted by any district detailing their policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Welcome to Smartsheet!
communications.communication:
Welcome! Now let’s get started

Your first step as a new Guest or Viewer is to access the item shared with you in Smartsheet and collaborate. That could mean adding a comment, making an edit, or simply viewing what was shared.

Log in now ➝ <https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/E4bccTNLDr0GJTjCKMX6SB-NH5ZiyxNt_DEvgNE1neI-UPMbq4ZbqbidwJnDw7J5oOWRaNGVsCOFFYxK6UG4pRDfGEjeDK4vMiZiEqDtX82HWD6xUbTL0osxdySfKGups41-aiWXnwp35oUmLaqjwRtVToN91A8xuypV4SFadOw=/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVRvwfYWLAE_gianR0axePaUOop1uM9sBLHxDSDiU83qhwsZ9nwdau_fvz6bO7zM415MVkvF0=>

What is Smartsheet?

Smartsheet is the enterprise platform for work management. We help teams plan work, do work, scale work, and enable anyone to drive meaningful change.

communications.subject: Learn how
communications.communication:
Learn how to work in Smartsheet

Our webinar for Guest and Viewers is the fastest and easiest way to learn how to use Smartsheet

Play the webinar → https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/wIQmyGhXZM4DmbvAyzH4NeaUth_uka6AQkCT1l4R7nQhZTVQLm8jP7ntKdjTILw5IbmzXrtJ51ehPPDww9TJL0BQNeESXnf9LO0RRta0MHNEKmCSXofKQTcawFGiodF9fviRUou-rzuQXtDTZiMTfwPXxo4ddCRheUaqXGjMzNBFu6EgbQTrPLBr2rqy4GxEEpSRyQJqZmB66ZdWCQ-u-g==/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVU1sV56jR1ZmHopZ3as3OTEflieji-jFzwwPqMoezzEwGytfd4aSv3QhFiKtgeajuSxVUR5Q=

--

What is a Guest and Viewer?

There are three primary types of users in Smartsheet, all with unique capabilities. If you’d like to create your own work and have greater access you’ll need to upgrade to a free trial or be granted Member access by a System Admin.

PLATFORM ACCESS
- Guest & Viewer: Free on someone else’s paid plan
- Trial Users: Free for 30 days
- Member: Buy a subscription or license granted Member access by organization

KEEP THE ITEMS YOU CREATE
- Guest & Viewer: Requires upgrade for full capability
- Trial Users: Requires upgrade
- Member: Yes

VIEW, EDIT, AND SHARE SHEETS*
- Guest & Viewers: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

ATTACH DOCUMENTS*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

COMMUNICATE WITH CONVERSATIONS AND PROOFING*
- Guest & Viewer: Included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE SHEETS, COLUMNS, AND FORMS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE OR USE PRE-MADE TEMPLATES
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

CREATE DASHBOARDS, PORTALS, AND REPORTS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

BUILD AUTOMATED WORKFLOWS
- Guest & Viewer: Not included
- Trial Users: Included
- Member: Included

--

*Guests and Viewers with Internal Admin or Editor permissions have the same access. Users with Viewer permissions can only view.

--

communications.subject: Take the next step
communications.communication:
Why you should consider upgrading

While there are many reasons users upgrade, the primary reason is to create and manage their own work in Smartsheet. Before upgrading, there are a few things you can do to make your experience even more successful: 

 - Learn how to use Smartsheet through our educational offerings.
 - Determine how Smartsheet can help you save time and improve collaboration.
 - Read our article about how to get Member access in Smartsheet, and more.

Check out the article → https://go.smartsheet.com/dc/wIQmyGhXZM4DmbvAyzH4NVrctJQfSXNoMZ_MBeQsn6Ac3uzy7UB9FlOd_4TZv5-upOmU8d8dEABWZnCsnxKUJSCNnFsie6sun4_KJRubT5yUQ2Pe_T3Eu8WxGjgGWPQYHhHTzbPr5HNp7sYvwGzc_adgWBdRp0h2uSdcoIYAqMsab_BgifFN8vn0vrvi1H7ngndiMoxamV3c2HjtHh-7wWEPjGRbRQ8Psc9w2OyFUFyMnQwf6iSTkjP8zVBZb2VEczFVHHs8BS8AsvvD40mlWg==/NDY0LU9OTS0xNDkAAAGVYs2xRJ6bW7VzfmcvFfUrAosbu6o-4ZLAuhLCi8Wu81vtl-bV6qTxOw74Lg9dvS-5_c7-WUo=

title: NYC Bail Fund Management Audit 2018 (Office of the Comptroller of New York City)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYC Bail Fund Management Audit 2018 (Office of the Comptroller of New York City)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All reports, summaries, and letters from the January 1–June 30, 2018 audit of the New York City Department of Finance's bail fund management.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

New York Focus

communications.subject: FOIL Request Receipt
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting your FOIL request. 
As required by New York State Public Officers Law
89(3)(a), within five business days of receiving your FOIL request, we will
complete the response to your FOIL request or provide an approximate date by
which we expect to complete the response to your FOIL request. 
If you have any questions regarding your request, please
send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov. (mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov)

communications.subject: RE: FOIL Request - New Submission
communications.communication:
This letter is in reference to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request that our office received on June 21, 2024.

Comptroller's Office staff are searching for records responsive to your FOIL request. Due to the volume of FOIL requests that our agency is handling; the limited agency staff processing thousands of FOIL requests; and the voluminous nature of your request, we need more time to respond to your request. Accordingly, we anticipate completing our response to your FOIL request by October 25, 2024. If circumstances arise that necessitate an extension beyond this date, we will notify you.

If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.

Sincerely,
NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit

communications.subject: RE: FOIL Request - New Submission
communications.communication:
Your Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL") request, dated June 21, 2024, sought the following records from the Office of the New York City Comptroller:



"All reports, summaries, and letters from the January 1-June 30, 2018 audit of the New York City Department of Finance's bail fund management."


Your request is granted. Your request for "reports, summaries, and letters" regarding the referenced June 21, 2019 Letter Report on the Department of Finance's Bail Fund Management is granted. The records are attached.



Note that internal memoranda created by Comptroller's Office's Bureau of Audit staff summarizing interviews and meetings conducted for this audit report have been withheld. These internal agency records may be permissibly withheld under N.Y.S. POL § 87(2)(g), which exempts inter- and intra-agency communications that are not (i) statistical or factual tabulations or data; (ii) instructions to staff that affect the public; (iii) final agency policy or determinations; or (iv) external audits.  Although inter-agency materials are "not defined under the FOIL statute, New York's courts have construed this term to mean deliberative material, i.e., communications exchanged for discussion purposes not constituting final policy decisions."  Russo v. Nassau Cty. Cmty. Coll., 81 N.Y.2d 690, 699 (1993); see also Tuck-It-Away Assocs., L.P. v. Empire State Dev. Corp., 54 A.D.3d 154, 166 (App. Div. 1st Dep't 2008) ("the purpose of the intra-agency exemption [is] to permit people within an agency to exchange opinions, advice and criticism freely and frankly, without the chilling prospect of public disclosure"); Gould v. New York City Police Department, 89 N.Y.2d 267, 277 (1986) (inter-agency materials are exempt from FOIL production if such materials include "opinions, ideas, or advice exchanged as part of the consultative or deliberative process of government decision making."). Accordingly, portions of the record where Comptroller's Office staff exchanged thoughts, opinions, and non-final drafts internally as part of the deliberative process of government decision-making have been withheld under N.Y.S. POL § 87(2)(g).



Under N.Y.S. Public Officers Law § 89(4), you have the right to appeal. Appeals must be submitted within 30 calendar days of receipt of this response and should be submitted by email to FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:FOIL@comptroller.nyc.gov>. Please put "FOIL Appeal" in the email's subject field. Appeals may also be mailed to the following address:



FOIL Appeals Officer

New York City Comptroller's Office

Office of the General Counsel

One Centre Street, Suite 602

New York, NY 10007



If you have any questions regarding your request, please send an email to our FOIL Officer at foil@comptroller.nyc.gov<mailto:foil@comptroller.nyc.gov>.



Sincerely,

NYC Comptroller's Office FOIL Unit

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Postal Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Postal Service)
communications.communication:
Dear United States Postal Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to United States Postal Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Biden Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Biden Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All letters, electronic or physical, from January 2017 to the present that were either sent to and received from Joseph R. Biden Jr. regarding documents and the Presidential Records Act (PRA). This can include all letters sent from NARA to his legal counsel that includes the following phrases: confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
2. All communications between NARA and the following individuals/entities located in the White House: Ron Klain, President Biden, and Dana Remus. The communications from both electronic and physical format are to be from January 2021 to the present date, and contain the following phrases: confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
3. All communications sent to and from the Department of Justice, including the office of the Attorney General, that contains the following phrases from January 2021 to the present date: Biden, confidential documents, presidential records act, and 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.
4. All memorandums produced by either the office of general counsel at NARA, Debra Wall, and David S. Ferriero from January 2017 to the present date that pertains to the presidential records act as stated in 44 U.S.C. 2201-2209.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Gamez

communications.subject: 25-028 FOIA Acknowledgement & Clarification
communications.communication:
Sia,

On Oct. 20, 2024:
Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Indian Health Service)
Dear Indian Health Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Indian Health Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: PDR_181

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: PDR_181
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails, text messages, chat messages (Teams, Slack, etc), and/or call logs regarding the fulfillment of PDR_181, including accompanying metadata. For any responsive chat and text messages, please provide messages sent/received in that thread within 1 hour of the responsive message as context.
2. Any notes, work logs, or other memoranda produced in the fulfillment of PDR_181.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: RE: Public Records Request 2024-05-12 08:16 PM(PST) Submission Notification - PDR_212 Terse
communications.communication:
Hi there,

Thank you for your public record request below for:
“MuckRock News, DEPT MR###### 263 Huntington Ave”


Please clarify what identifiable records you are requesting. State law requires the City to respond to requests for “identifiable public records” (RCW 42.56.080). An identifiable public record is one in which the requester has given "a reasonable description” enabling the government employee to locate the requested records. A date range may also help us identify records responsive to the request. If we do not receive clarification on what types of identifiable records you are requesting within thirty (30) days by Friday, June 14, we will close the request.


Your request has been assigned Public Records Request Number PDR_212 Terse

We are in the process of gathering, identifying, and reviewing records responsive to your request, and the records request is currently being processed by the Administrative Services department. It will take approximately 8-10 weeks to fulfill this request. Please know that this is only an estimate. Records can become available sooner or later than the estimated time given.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact me. I will be in contact with you shortly.



Thank you,

Megan Brehm
Deputy City Clerk

City of Burien
(206) 988-3578 Office
(206) 707-4894 City Cell
MeganB@burienwa.gov<mailto:MeganB@burienwa.gov>
Burienwa.gov
NOTICE OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE: This e-mail account is public domain. Any correspondence from or to this e-mail account may be a public record. Accordingly, this e-mail, in whole or in part, may be subject to disclosure pursuant to RCW 42.56, regardless of any claim of confidentiality or privilege asserted by an external party.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #PDR_212
communications.communication:
Hello Megan,

In your previous message, you require that I clarify what “identifiable records” I am requesting within 30 days, citing RCW 42.56.080. My request specifically states "All emails, text messages, chat messages (Teams, Slack, etc), and/or call logs [...]" in item 1 and "Any notes, work logs, or other memoranda [...]" in item 2 specifically regarding public records request PDR_181. While 42.56.080 classifies "A request for all or substantially all records prepared, owned, used, or retained by an agency" as an invalid request, the statute continues "a request for all records regarding a particular topic or containing a particular keyword or name shall not be considered a request for all of an agency's records". The topic is clearly discernable from my original request: records "regarding the fulfillment of PDR_181".

Additionally, you ask for a "date range". It would be reasonable to assume that the date range would begin on the date the request was filed (April 14) until the date this request was received, rather than threatening to close my request if no clarification is provided. This is common practice by other municipal agencies I have requested similar records from.

As you are familiar with the Washington Public Records Act, it is hard not to wonder whether these are attempts to unreasonably delay my request or otherwise deny me access to the requested records. I again respectfully ask that I be provided with the full breadth of the requested information without unreasonable delay.

Thank you,
Rose

communications.subject: PDR_212_2nd Installment_Closed
communications.communication:
Rose,
The second installment of requested record(s) has been uploaded to a file sharing app. Once you click on the link below, you can download the record(s). You may need to install Adobe Acrobat Reader (a free PDF reader) to view and download the record(s). If you have any trouble with these instructions or have issues accessing the link, please let me know as soon as possible.

https://burienwa.box.com/s/wvsm5ljy6mpkedg3dw2gkb3n796anshc

The link will be available until 11/24/2024.

Burien has completed its search for records responsive to public records request PDR_212 and provided all responsive records and aapplicable exemption/redactions are noted directly into the applicable document. PDR 212 is considered fulfilled and closed on 10/25/24. This is Burien’s final response to your request.

You have  30 calendar days to request follow-up on your request or the responsive records, and may seek judicial review as provided by RCW Chapter 42.56, Public Records Act.

Please use our online public records request submission form here for any new requests:
https://www.burienwa.gov/city_hall/laws_regulations/public_record_request/public_records_request_form

Sincerely,
Cathy Schrock
Interim Public Records Manager
Cathys@burienwa.gov<mailto:Cathys@burienwa.gov>

title: U.S. Marshals - intergovernmental service agreementals wth county sheriffs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: U.S. Marshals - intergovernmental service agreementals wth county sheriffs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

I request all active contracts and/or intergovernmental service agreements with county sheriffs' offices for the housing, safekeeping and subsistence of federal detainees.

This request is being made for the purposes of newsgathering for MuckRock.com, not for any commercial interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public after being processed by a member of the news media.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Frank Matt

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Labor Relations Authority)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Labor Relations Authority)
communications.communication:
Dear Federal Labor Relations Authority,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Federal Labor Relations Authority's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: FOIA Request for Records: Detective Stephen E. Gardell (1947–2015)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request for Records: Detective Stephen E. Gardell (1947–2015)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records pertaining to mentioning or mentioning Stephen E. Gardell, a deceased Detective of the New York City Police Department. He was also Treasurer of the Detectives Endowment Association. He was also the subject of an investigation for his association with the Bonanno and Colombo Crime Families of La Cosa Nostra, and pled guilty to wire fraud in 2001.

To assist in the location of records and ruling out records of similarly named persons, the following identifying information about Gardell is known:

Month/Year of birth: 6/1947
Date of death: 06/16/2015
BOP Inmate register number: 49457-054

Gardell's death was reported in 2015 (see obituary attached); records naming or concerning Gardell have diminished privacy interests recognized under both the Privacy Act and the privacy exemptions to FOIA.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System and FBI Data Warehouse System, including but not limited to the ELSUR Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS), for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

    or concerning Gardell have diminished privacy interests recognized under
    both the Privacy Act and the privacy exemptions to FOIA.
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System and FBI Data Warehouse
    System, including but not limited to the ELSUR Records System, the
    Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR)
    Indices, the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counterdrug Information
    Indices System (CIIS), for both main-file records and cross-reference
    records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.
    
    If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred
    to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well

    transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that

    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look

    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    T. McElwee
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/LXHXZZTVENTLKU/86560/Gardellobituary.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffoia-request-for-records-detective-stephen-e-gardell-19472015-98379%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2MnNxOre1oSHteLnfMK20oc%3A1jxN4q%3A85t6zeRMDx8aun3PTqlPwFlFHcs

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1470962-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Tri-state form 1575s

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All form 1575s submitted by the Departments of Transportation of New Jersey, Connecticut, and New York State from 2021-present

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s
communications.communication:
Mr. Mellins, thank you for your FOIA request recently submitted to the Office of the Secretary of Transportation (OST).  I don’t think we have anything to do with a “Form 1575”, but I see some indications that two other US DOT components might.

1. Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA)
https://ask.fmcsa.dot.gov/app/mcmiscatalog/mcmisform1575
Online report payment form for the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration (FMCSA).

2. Federal Highway Administration (FHWA)
https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/cfo/earmarkrepurposing/fhwa1575_example1_erp2023.pdf
FHWA Transfer Request: Earmark Repurposing

Does either one of them look like what you’re interested in?  If so, we can forward your request to the correct DOT component.  If you still believe this is a matter for OST, could you tell me a little more about the topic matter to help me track it down?

Thank you,
Dave Jones
OST FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thanks for this message. I think my request would be better directed to the FHWA. I'd be grateful if you could forward it to them. 

Sam Mellins

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tri-state form 1575s
communications.communication: You got it.  I’ll send it their way.  No further action is required on your part.  Thanks.

title: 07/24 RTK Whitehall Bureau of Police

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: 07/24 RTK Whitehall Bureau of Police
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

This Right-to-Know request is for the following documents regarding Whitehall Township Bureau of Police involvement in the rally, held on 4/13/2024, for former President Donald J. Trump at the Schnecksville Fire Company fairgrounds:

1. A roster of all employees of the department, including but not limited to first name, last name, badge number, salary, and date of hire.
2. All emails, text messages, call logs, and/or other communications among members of the department and between the department and other local, state, federal and campaign entities regarding the rally. Please provide communications that occurred any time between January 1, 2024 and the date of this request.
3. All invoices, memoranda of understanding or other such agreements showing and/or describing the services the department provided for the rally.
4. All overtime requests submitted to the department for hours worked on 4/13/2024.
5. Documents showing active shooter protocols for the department, including documents outlining any training department employees have taken in the past five years.

Please note, this request is not misdirected. I know the rally on 4/13/2024 occurred outside Whitehall Township police jurisdiction. However, photo and video from that day shows Whitehall Township police provided support.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Danielle Ohl

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: 07/24 RTK Whitehall Bureau of Police
communications.communication:
Danielle,

Per the Statute, Whitehall is invoking a 30-day review period for your request.  There are legal issues related to this request which are currently under review by our attorneys.

Regards,

Jack

Jack D. Meyers
Deputy Mayor
Whitehall Township
3219 MacArthur Road
Whitehall, PA 18052
610-437-5524 x1148

title: Sheriff data collection (2017-2022) (Stokes County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Sheriff data collection (2017-2022) (Stokes County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents from 2017-2022, separated by year. Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in 2022 were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations. 
2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year and type of force, from 2017-2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, etc.)
3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.  
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year. 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year.  
6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2017-2022, separated by year. 
7. the total number of officer-involved shootings from 2017-2022, both fatal and non-fatal, separated by year.
8. the total number of people who the sheriff’s department used force against, broken down by race/ethnicity, in 2022.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.  

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: A list of pending Title IX sexual violence investigations at post-secondary institutions in Nevada

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: A list of pending Title IX sexual violence investigations at post-secondary institutions in Nevada
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of pending Title IX sexual violence investigations at post-secondary institutions in the state of Nevada released by the Office of Civil Rights from August 2020 to the date your office processes this request, inclusive. Please provide them in spread-sheet format — for example, CSV or XLSX — if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Cabrera

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: A list of pending Title IX sexual violence investigations at post-secondary institutions in Nevada
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This message is for Jessica Cabrera regarding the FOIA request reproduced below.

The Seattle OCR office has been processing this request, and I am hoping to connect with you to clarify your request.  Were you looking for a list of sexual violence cases filed against post-secondary institutions in Nevada since August 2020, a list of complaints still open, or something different?

Cases currently open for investigation can be found at OCR’s Open Investigations<https://ocrcas.ed.gov/open-investigations> webpage (https://ocrcas.ed.gov/open-investigations?field_ois_state=678&field_ois_discrimination_statute=701&field_ois_type_of_discrimination=727&items_per_page=20&field_ois_institution=&field_ois_institution_type=752&field_open_investigation_date_1=&field_open_investigation_date_2=&field_open_investigation_date=&field_open_investigation_date_3=), but this webpage does not provide historical data.

Please feel free to email me back or call me at the number below.  I am generally available between 8 am and 5 pm pacific time, but I can be available during other times upon request.

Thank you,

Margot Stevens

Attorney
Office for Civil Rights, Seattle Office
US Department of Education
915 Second Ave, Suite 3310
Seattle, WA 98174

Email: margot.stevens@ed.gov<mailto:margot.stevens@ed.gov>

Phone: 202-987-1245
Fax: 206-607-1601
TDD Relay Service: 1-800-877-8339
Web: https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ocr/index.html

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-01411-F
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I was hoping to receive a list of sexual violence cases filed against post-secondary institutions in Nevada since August 2020, but would it be possible to expand the request to include all types of discrimination? If expanding the request is overly broad, I am willing accept historical records since August 2020 about sexual violence cases in particular.

Best,
Jessica
